website_summaries.verdict: In spite of some quirks and longevity concerns, this model is worth considering if you like the idea of adding heat to your massage.
pros: In addition to three massage modes, this ball heats up to aid in calming aching muscles and soothing pressure points
cons: It's easy to accidentally change the mode settings
A few reports of balls that quit working after several uses

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Buy a $3 lacrosse ball instead.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these in Oct 2017. I did really enjoy how it worked, when it worked. After about two months, it would not hold a charge anymore, so no heat, no vibration. It was basically a textured lacrosse ball. I just figured I had bad luck on the purchase. I bought a second one just a couple weeks ago, because I did like the way it worked. I’ve used it leas than three weeks and now it won’t vibrate. At all. I’m sorry to say, this is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Springer

customer_reviews.title: Its battery power lasts a good long time with vibration and heat which are great
customer_reviews.text: Its larger than croquet or lacrosse balls so it wont be too effective at getting in between the shoulder blade however it does have its merits. Its battery power lasts a good long time with vibration and heat which are great. Someone with knots like mine that make grown male masseuses cry, wont have a lot of success with this ball other than to loosen up tension.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany M

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Weak and mostly useless. The vibration is equivalent to a ringing cellphone in your pocket The heat is warm. Nor sure what use this product may have but as a massage ball its a fail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have had this for 3 days. Used twice ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 3 days. Used twice. The 2nd time i used this it wont vibrate. I cannot find a return, it says item not returnable. Keep your money, do not buy
customer_reviews.author: rl

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only used this ball on myself, but I really like how it heats and vibrates. I can put it between my back and the headboard on my bed, and press against it to get the pressure I want and target tight muscles in my back and shoulders. Laying down, I can target muscles in my hips that sometimes bother me. Easy to recharge. So far I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Gamboa

customer_reviews.title: Product gets a little hot
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it does the job. It gets a little too hot (I end up turning the heat on/off), and for my money doesn't vibrate as much as I hoped it would. That said, I've used it most every day for 6 months and it still charges well and held up to my abuse. Because of that, and the price, I give it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Works for only days
customer_reviews.text: The ball only vibrated the first two times of use.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Not working

customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy robbed customer
customer_reviews.text: Does not do anything that is noticeable a total sham of a product do not buy this! Also won’t accept returns so now I have an unattractive blue paper weight!
customer_reviews.author: TRAVIS

customer_reviews.title: Heating massage ball
customer_reviews.text: This heating massage ball is perfect to target those small areas that are hard to reach with a chair!! I used it for my sciatic nerve area.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: The vibration is weak and changes modes while I'm using ...
customer_reviews.text: The vibration is weak and changes modes while I'm using it. Doesn't do much for my tight calves. Should have invested in a Hyperice. No returns
customer_reviews.author: Al C.

customer_reviews.title: So far...a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: It just arrived and of course I had to try it immediately... So far, only somewhat impressed with it's efficacy. I am loaded with TPs and most are lurking in my mid back. I am revising my review to somewhat disappointed. Yes it does heat up nicely, yes it does vibrate but that has not translated into a useful tool for me to get relief from those nasty little toxic TPs. I am finding it very difficult to actually apply the ball to specific pain points in a therapeutic way. Wish I hadnt spent the $$.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer in Florida

customer_reviews.title: We've been using them for about 2 months now and they are still in perfect working order
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 for our physical therapy clinic. We've been using them for about 2 months now and they are still in perfect working order. We also tested it out on charging a cel phone - which it did in about 3 hours. If your problem is involuntary muscle contractions, this is the product for you; especially in the glutes and hips. The heat speeds up the spasm reduction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the ball.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ball. It does take awhile for it to heat up. I love the sling. It makes it easier to hold in the spot on my back that hurts.
customer_reviews.author: C Smith

customer_reviews.title: Gets into those knots!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome on the wall or floor right behind my shoulder blade where I get huge mouse and keyboard knots! Charges well and lasts long enough. It gets nice and warm not too hot, good strong vibration.
customer_reviews.author: horseme

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé absolutely loves this product! I got it for him for Christmas and it’s been his go to for muscle relief every sense. He might actually marry me now!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: It just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: While easy to use, it doesn't last long. I think mine only lasted a few days before it stopped vibrating. Can't even return it either due to Amazon policy. Just be aware.

customer_reviews.title: great for hard to reach trigger points
customer_reviews.text: This is really terrific for hard to reach trigger points and really does work. Love it!

customer_reviews.title: Ball works great on aches
customer_reviews.text: My significant other has serve back and neck problems the ball works great

customer_reviews.title: Excellent massage tool
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time everyday before the computer screen. I used the massage stick to massage my soar or painful wrists, neck, shoulders and back. I purchased an acumo massage last October. Since then, I only use acumo massage ball. Its heat function makes the massage effect double and comfortable. It is portable. I can enjoy the massage anywhere. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mercy Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: I got this for myself and it great that I bought another as a gift
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Good idea....
customer_reviews.text: This idea is extremely genius. The only problem is that it just doesn't do anything good besides be a portable battery for my phone. The ball needs to be a BALL. Not round with weird grooves. The more surface area to potentially come in contact with the tissue, the better it will be at manipulating tissue. It needs to be a full ball. Also, the vibration really let me down. This vibration is for putting you to sleep, not for actually getting into muscle and helping with relieving "tight spots". The heat was nice and i think it heats the best it could. Overall, I should have bought a lacrosse ball and a portable battery charger from ROSS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
